content: sweater bag charm materialsandtools abbreviations size 1 2 25 mm 32 circular needle k - knit for magic loop p - purl 35 yards 32 meters of fingering kfb - knit front back increase weight yarn pm - place marker 4 stitch markers one unique to sm - slip marker indicate bor bor - beginning of round or tapestry needle to weave in ends beginning of round marker sts - stitches sewing needle and thread ~3 of ribbon techniques keychain and clasp long tail cast on backwards loop cast on 1x1 rib - knit 1 stitch purl 1 stitch knit front back kfb increases background bag charms bag charms knit your own bag charms i ve been inspired by the resurgence of 90s maximalist bag adornment but your finished object can also be used as a keychain ornament brooch gift embellishment or anything else your beautiful brain conceptualizes instructions are provided for how to knit the basic mini-sweater shape get creative add charm to your charm with stripes color-blocking duplicate stitch embroidery or sparkle seamlessly knit from the top down beginning with the neckline ribbing compound raglan increases are made with knit front-back increases to shape the yoke sleeve stitches are put on hold and stitches are cast on at the underarm the body of the sweater is knit in the round has a 1x1 rib hem and is bound off knitwise sleeve stitches are placed back on the needles worked in the round and feature 1x1 ribbed cuff weave in your ends block your tiny sweater and sew a loop of fabric or ribbon to the inside of your project for easy display castonandknitneckband with size 1 2 25mm needles cast on 26 stitches using a long tail cast on place bor marker and join in the round work 4 rounds of 1 x 1 rib raglansetup slip bor marker k 4 pm k 9 pm k 4 pm k9 to return to bor marker you have marked out your front and back 9 stitches for front and back and your sleeves 4 stitches for each sleeve when working magic loop i found it easiest to arrange my stitches like this raglanincreases round 1 increase at each seam slip bor marker *kfb knit until 2 stitches remain before the next marker kfb k1 slip maker* repeat ** until you reach the bor 6 sts for each sleeve 11 sts for front and back 34 sts total 8 sts increased round 2 increase body slip bor marker *knit all sleeve stitches slip maker kfb knit until 2 stitches remain before the next marker kfb k1 slip marker* 6 sts for each sleeve 13 sts for front and back 38 sts total 4 sts increased round 3 no increase knit all stitches slipping markers as you get to them round 4 increase at each seam slip bor marker *kfb knit until 2 stitches remain before the next marker kfb k1 slip maker* repeat ** until you reach the bor 8 sts
